DOCNAME: CASE OF MOROZ AND OTHERS v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (exhaustion);Violation of Art 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON Mykhailenko , PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON , and PERSON are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE , and DATE , respectively . PERSON lives in the town of PERSON and the others live in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants gave ORG certain amounts of money in order that it could buy cars for them . The company concluded a contract with a third person , pursuant to which the latter undertook to provide the applicants with the cars .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG , acting in the interests of the applicants , together with CARDINAL other persons , instituted proceedings in ORG of Kyiv ( the “ FAC ” ) against the company for failure to fulfil its contractual obligations , namely , to provide the applicants and other persons concerned with the cars . The company denied that it had any contractual obligations in this respect .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered an expert examination and suspended the proceedings . On DATE the expert report was completed and the proceedings were resumed .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants , together with CARDINAL other persons , lodged with the same court their separate claims in respect of the subject matter of the proceedings . The plaintiffs sought the recovery of the amounts which they had paid to the company and compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ruled against the applicants , finding no fault on the part of the company .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the “ ORG
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered an additional expert examination which was completed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in part for the applicants . On DATE the same court adopted a supplementary decision , partly changing the operative part of its judgment of DATE , which still remained favourable to the applicants . These decisions were not appealed against and became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG lodged a protest with the ORG of that court , seeking initiation of supervisory review proceedings in the case . On DATE the ORG allowed the protest , quashed the decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It held that the first instance court had failed to establish the legal nature of the contract between the applicants and the company .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date PERSON N. , one of the plaintiffs in the case , requested his claims to be disjoined . On DATE ORG allowed his request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in part for Mr N. This decision was not appealed against and became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG lodged a protest with the ORG of ORG , seeking initiation of supervisory review proceedings in the case . On DATE the ORG allowed the protest , quashed the judgment of DATE , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It mostly reiterated the reasons for its decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date Mr ORG joined the original proceedings as a co - plaintiff .
CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings DATE and DATE the applicants amended the claims twice .

CARDINAL . Of around CARDINAL hearings held during the aforementioned period CARDINAL were adjourned due to the absence or at the request of the applicants ' representatives . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the absence of the representatives of the defendant company and QUANTITY hearings were postponed because of the witnesses ' failure to appear . CARDINAL hearings were not held due to the absence of the judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , and CARDINAL DATE the court fined the representatives of the defendant company for their repeated failure to appear before the court . CARDINAL of the witnesses called by the court was fined twice for the same reasons .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in part for the applicants . This decision was not appealed against and became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG lodged a protest with the ORG of ORG , seeking initiation of supervisory review proceedings in the case . On DATE the ORG allowed the protest , quashed the judgment of DATE , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It held that the first instance court had wrongly applied the law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG requested the President of ORG to remit the case to ORG , as this case had been reconsidered by ORG on CARDINAL occasions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG granted the request of the President of ORG and remitted the case to a judge of ORG for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the former ORG ) , acting as a court of first instance , scheduled a hearing for DATE , which was not held because of the judge 's illness .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE there were CARDINAL hearings held , out of which CARDINAL were adjourned at the request of the defendant company and CARDINAL was postponed due to the submission of the amended claims by the applicants ' representative .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' representative lodged an appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and Mr PERSON , acting in the interests of all the applicants and other claimants , lodged a separate appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the applicants a time - limit to rectify the shortcomings of the appeal in cassation of DATE and to pay the court fees .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL and DATE CARDINAL of the applicants , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , submitted to the court copies of the receipts , conforming that they had paid the court fees in respect of the latter appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected the appeal in cassation lodged by the applicant 's representative on DATE for failure to pay the court fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same court sent the appeal in cassation lodged on DATE by ORG and PERSON PERSON , acting in the interests of all the applicants and other claimants , to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG decided to submit the latter appeal for consideration by ORG of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . ORG , sitting in a different composition , held DATE hearings . QUANTITY hearings were postponed because of the absence of the applicants ' representative or at his request , while QUANTITY hearings were adjourned at the request of the defendant company .
CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before that court , the applicants modified their claims twice .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found in part for the applicants . It held that the company had been under the obligation to provide the plaintiffs with the cars , which the company had failed to fulfil . The court ordered the company to pay each plaintiff ORG CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL and DATE , respectively , the defendant company and the applicants appealed in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the parties ' appeals in cassation .
